metadata.title: The Atlantic Road
metadata.story: Driving The Atlantic Road was great fun, with plenty of amazing scenery along the way. This stop, at a famous Bridge along the route was a highlight. We didn't plan to stop there for long, but ended up spending about an hour walking along the highway to get photos and watch people fish.

metadata.title: Grasslands and fjords
metadata.story: Road trips and relaxing. Norway did the trick with both.

metadata.title: Reflection of a house
metadata.story: When we started driving in Norway, we found it hard not to stop every few kilometers at another place that just made us go "wow!!". This photo was taken during a quick lunch stop on our first day driving from Bergen to Oda.

metadata.title: Boat on the fjord
metadata.altText: Wooden boat huts sit on the edge of a fjord, with a small boat moored in front of them. The water is calm and the sky is overcast. Mountains in the background have low cloud cover.
metadata.story: Serene scenes like this were common while we drove alongside the fjords in Norway. Unfortunately for us we had mostly rainy weather during the day, otherwise we would have probably taken our chances to jump in as well!

metadata.title: Fruit stall
metadata.altText: A white hut with red trimming and a black roof sits in a pulloff area by a road. It has a Norwegian flag flying from its roof. Inside are a collection of fruits and berries for sale. There's no person at the stall, it's based on an honesty system.
metadata.story: Probably my favourite part of driving around Norway during the summer was stopping off at little roadside stalls like this one that dotted the countryside. In each was a different selection of local fruits and vegetables for sale, most of the time paid for by putting some cash into an honesty box. The berries were absolutely fantastic, better than anything I've had elsewhere.

metadata.title: Fjord cruises
metadata.altText: A view from up high, looking down into a town by a bay in a fjord. The hills and land around the town are green, with low misty cloud floating above. There's a cruise ship parked in the center of the picture, in the middle of the bay in the fjord.
metadata.story: Tourism is a pretty big part of the economy in Norway's fjord regions, and it's not uncommon to see large cruise ships floating in the bays outside of towns in the area. It wasn't my favourite sight, but this shot did turn out pretty good, ship and all.

metadata.title: Red church
metadata.altText: A church spire bathed in sunlight. The red wood of the church building contrasts with the blue sky behind.
metadata.story: This Stave Church in Kvernes was different to the others we'd seen on our trip. It looked more like a traditional church, but inside there was still definitely a sea-faring, viking feeling that we experienced in other Stave Churches we visited.

metadata.title: Seagulls
metadata.altText: Two seagulls sitting on a railing, the Atlantic Ocean behind them.
metadata.story: Regular companions during our time on the Atlantic Coast. These two were very small compared to some of the other seagulls that we encountered.

metadata.title: A rare glimpse of sunset
metadata.altText: A concrete path leads to the water's edge between low shurbs. Small embankments dot the water, with a faint pinkish hue lighting the sky at sunset.
metadata.story: We didn't get many clear evenings while in Norway, so this sunset was pretty nice to take in after a day of driving The Atlantic Road.

metadata.title: Line ups for the ferry
metadata.altText: A car waits in a numbered line in an otherwise empty parking lot. They are waiting in a cark park by the water for the incoming ferry.
metadata.story: We got very comfortable with taking the ferry between destinations in the fjords during our time in Norway. They were well maintained, and some even had very comfortable passenger rooms where we could snack and pass the time on the (normally) short trips.
